intro: Hippolytia leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leafed fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery or white underside, giving it its common name. It is a short-lived perennial that produces numerous blooms during the spring and summer months.
